answers.answer: yes this puts you on a diet and risk for other minor things like over weight baby.just be careful about wat u eat you will be fine.after 30 weeks you will get more ultra sound tomonitor fluids around baby.
I'm actually on 32 week right now.
I failed my one hour tooBut my doctor sent me for a three hours thankfully everything came out perfect. I am 32 weeks as well

I am 23 w 4 d. With my first I was diagnosed with GD, and we are treating me as if I am with my 2nd. I'll be doing the 1 hr test soon to be sure. Some tips for you though. I'm the mornings avoid fruit and juices. Keep milk low in the mornings as well. Try to do high protein as it will keep you full. Avoid carbs, they turn into sugar and will spike your blood glucose levels. Snack between meals, veggies and cheese are perfect because they have low carb or no carbs. Good luck, and follow the diet you are told by your doctor/dietician and you and your little one will be just fine.

question: I fail on my 1 hr test, so I was scheduled to do a 2 hr glucose test. My result I was good on my before and 2 hr blood draw, but my one hr was still high. So now I have to go through a lot of doctor appointment for gestational diabetes. Anyone been through it? This will be my first pregnancy.
title: Anyone diagnose gestational diabetes?
